books.title: To Cuba and Back
books.author: Richard Henry Dana Jr.
books.summary: A captivating travel memoir recounting an 1859 journey to Cuba, offering vivid descriptions of the island’s culture, landscapes, and people.

books.title: The Elusive Pimpernel
books.author: Baroness Orczy
books.summary: A French official schemes to finally catch the Scarlet Pimpernel.

books.title: Geronimo’s Story of His Life
books.author: Geronimo
books.summary: The Apache war chief Geronimo recounts the story of his life.

books.title: A General History of the Pirates
books.author: Captain Charles Johnson
books.summary: The lives and stories of the daring pirate outlaws who terrorized the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea in the 18th century.

books.title: Catriona
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: After coming into his fortune and evading his uncle’s schemes, young gentleman David Balfour continues his adventures in 18th century Scotland, helping a politically unwelcome friend escape into France, avoiding the hangman himself, finding his place as a gentleman in Edinburgh society, and falling in love with the daughter of a notorious Macgregor clansman.

books.title: The Conscious Lovers
books.author: Richard Steele
books.summary: A rich young man tries to avoid the marriage his father has arranged.

books.title: Heartbreak House
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: Men and women of the English leisured classes gather at a country house on the eve of war to discuss love, life, and the future.

books.title: At the Back of the North Wind
books.author: George MacDonald
books.summary: A young boy’s life is transformed by his visit to the country at the back of the north wind.

books.title: Stover at Yale
books.author: Owen Johnson
books.summary: A young prep school football star arrives at Yale, where he grows and develops on the football field and off.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Arthur Machen
books.summary: A collection of nine short fiction works by influential supernatural and horror author Arthur Machen.

books.title: The Hashish Eater
books.author: Fitz Hugh Ludlow
books.summary: A philosophical contemplation of youthful adventures spent ingesting large doses of psychoactive cannabis extract.

books.title: The Secret Adversary
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: Tommy and Tuppence try to solve a mystery, only to find themselves embroiled in schemes of murder, millionaires, and diplomats.

books.title: Yashka
books.author: Maria Bochkareva
books.summary: A Russian peasant leaves exile in Siberia to fight for her country in World War I.

books.title: The Wealth of Nations
books.author: Adam Smith
books.summary: Adam Smith lays the foundation of classical economics.

books.title: Songs of a Sourdough
books.author: Robert W. Service
books.summary: A collection of poems about the Klondike Gold Rush.

books.title: Where Angels Fear to Tread
books.author: E. M. Forster
books.summary: After an English widow on holiday impetuously falls in love with a handsome young Tuscan, her panicked in-laws send a rescue party.

books.title: The Food of the Gods
books.author: H. G. Wells
books.summary: Two scientists discover a substance which promotes rapid and extreme growth in plants, animals, and humans, leading to unexpected and alarming consequences.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Cordwainer Smith
books.summary: A collection of short stories by Cordwainer Smith ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Religion and the Rise of Capitalism
books.author: R. H. Tawney
books.summary: A tracing of the development of religious thought from the Middle Ages to the dawn of the Industrial Revolution.

books.title: Through the Brazilian Wilderness
books.author: Theodore Roosevelt
books.summary: Theodore Roosevelt’s autobiographical account of his expedition into the uncharted depths of the Brazilian rainforest.
